body_html:
LuongAttention implements the following paper:

Minh-Thang Luong, Hieu Pham, Christopher D. Manning.
"Effective Approaches to Attention-based Neural Machine Translation."
EMNLP 2015. https://arxiv.org/abs/1508.04025

both attentions have a scaling option (Luong it's called "scale" and Bahdanau it's called "normalize"). The Luong scaling version is unpublished; the Bahdanau normalize option is based on a recent paper by colin raffel.

Either way; that really is the only difference between the two attention mechanisms. Everything else is the same. Is there a specific term that you feel should be different between the two?

both attentions have a scaling option (Luong it's called "scale" and Bahdanau it's called "normalize").  The Luong scaling version is unpublished; the Bahdanau normalize option is based on a recent paper by colin raffel.
Either way; that really is the only difference between the two attention mechanisms.  Everything else is the same.  Is there a specific term that you feel should be different between the two?
body:
LuongAttention implements the following paper:

Minh-Thang Luong, Hieu Pham, Christopher D. Manning.
  "Effective Approaches to Attention-based Neural Machine Translation."
  EMNLP 2015.  https://arxiv.org/abs/1508.04025

both attentions have a scaling option (Luong it's called "scale" and Bahdanau it's called "normalize").  The Luong scaling version is unpublished; the Bahdanau normalize option is based on a recent paper by colin raffel.

Either way; that really is the only difference between the two attention mechanisms.  Everything else is the same.  Is there a specific term that you feel should be different between the two?
